snippet.title: Positive control of a regulon for defenses against oxidative stress and some heat-shock proteins in Salmonella typhimurium
snippet.description:
* Positive control of a regulon for defenses against oxidative stress and some heat-shock proteins in Salmonella typhimurium (Citations: 326)
Michael F. Christman, Robin W. Morgan, Fredric S. Jacobson, Bruce N. Ames
Summary S. typhimurium become resistant to killing by hydro- gen peroxide and other oxidants when pretreated with nonlethal levels of hydrogen peroxide. During adapta- tion to hydrogen peroxide, 30 proteins are induced. Nine are constitutively overexpressed in dominant hydrogen peroxide-resistant oxyR mutants. Mutant oxyR1 is resistant to a variety of oxidizing agents and overexpresses at least five enzyme activities ...
Journal: Cell , vol. 41, no. 3, pp. 753-762, 1985
